Please convey my warmest greetings:"Bobby Corddick,fuck you!"

[h1]Shameless PALADINS ripoff! [/h1]

This small indie company Blazzerd just made a ripoff of an incredible game PALADINS that was available since may of 2018 and was critically acclaimed by 85% positive user rating. 
As you see this Overwhat game with 22% approval is really really far from reaching that Paladins unshakable position. 

They stole everything mechanics, game mode, even characters!  

Remember [b]Androuxus [/b] in Paladins? What a cool and memorable character! In Overwatch they made two characters based on Androxus! His look is used to create a character, which they named in the most cliche way - The Reaper... Wow... Very creative. 
And they stole gameplay and mechanics from Androxus to create a [b] COWBOY character with unremarkable name Cassidy [/b]. Do they even have a bit of fantasy?! Even I can come up with better name! For example... McCree! Sounds much cooler, right?

The only thing they could not copy is the horses! - I guess it is too advanced for them. 

The monetization in the game is awful! You need to buy characters and all suits costs like good indie games on Steam that people actually put efford in. 

Remember Paladins collab with RWBY? The developers actually made the new, unique skins to represent characters from the show. In Uverwatch, they had collab with One punch man, and they just repainted the suit of one of the characters - Kiriko, and added her a new hair. Wow! 25 dollars please and no regional prices! Cheers love, the monetization is here!

Anyway guys, I don't know what else to say. You see that Avengerswatch has 22% positive rating while the remarkable, unbeaten Paladins has 85% positive rating! 
So just go and play better game!..

Me gustaba mucho Overwatch 1; tengo mÃ¡s de 100 horas registradas en Battle.net. Sin embargo, siento que Overwatch 2 simplemente repite la misma fÃ³rmula con un sistema de monetizaciÃ³n bastante desacertado. Antes, podÃ­as obtener cajas de botÃ­n y de vez en cuando conseguÃ­as una skin interesante. Ahora, te cobran 7 dÃ³lares por skin, y el costo puede aumentar segÃºn su rareza.

AdemÃ¡s, me resulta frustrante que hayan eliminado un puesto de jugador tan crucial como el de tanque en las partidas, usando una excusa que solo los profesionales podrÃ­an comprender. Esto ha generado problemas, ya que la composiciÃ³n de 6 jugadores que funcionaba en Overwatch 1 no se adapta correctamente a un juego con solo 5 puestos.

Otro aspecto que me preocupa es cÃ³mo han ajustado la potencia de los personajes de soporte y tanque para compensar la ausencia del sexto jugador. Esto ha llevado a que los tanques se sientan como versiones mejoradas de DPS con mÃ¡s resistencia. Y, en general el tanke termina siendo el MVP sea por su daÃ±o o resistencia durante las partidas

En resumen, aunque disfrutÃ© mucho de Overwatch 1, siento que Overwatch 2 ha perdido el rumbo al implementar un sistema de monetizaciÃ³n poco favorable y realizar cambios que afectan negativamente la dinÃ¡mica de juego y el balance entre los roles. OjalÃ¡ puedan abordar estas cuestiones para mejorar la experiencia en Overwatch 2.

To be honest, Overwatch 2 is disappointing. The game has many bugs, making it feel rushed. It seems like Blizzard just wants to make money from selling skins rather than creating a good game. The drama around the PVP cancellation made Blizzard look bad. The worst part? If you actually join this game, be ready to get frustrated for your entire day. After winning one or two games, you're going to play with AI teammates that you can't believe are humans. Things like you will get some players get more death than kills (KD lower than 1 is really hard in this game, but yes Match system will put these AI player on your team). Your enemy team will be sweaty ass smurfing 3~5 stack really to smash your face, and the Overwatch team actually thinks this matchmaking system is genius. With all these issues, and things I can't even list them all, why would anyone want to play this game again or even try it for the first time?
